en.label: Greyhawk Calendar (D&D)
en.description: The Common Year calendar system used in the World of Greyhawk, the classic D&D campaign setting. Features twelve months and four festival weeks that fall outside normal monthly structure.

months.name: Fireseek
months.description: The first month of winter. Named for the desperate search for fire and warmth during the coldest part of the year.

months.name: Readying
months.description: The second month of winter. A time of preparation and planning for the coming spring planting season.

months.name: Coldeven
months.description: The third month of winter. The harshest and most bitter month, when cold winds dominate the land.

months.name: Planting
months.description: The first month of spring. The season of sowing begins as farmers plant their crops for the coming harvest.

months.name: Flocktime
months.description: The second month of spring. Animals give birth and flocks grow as nature awakens from winter slumber.

months.name: Wealsun
months.description: The third month of spring. The sun grows strong and wealthy, bringing prosperity and growth to the lands.

months.name: Reaping
months.description: The first month of summer. The early harvest begins as the first crops reach maturity under the summer sun.

months.name: Goodmonth
months.description: The second month of summer. A favorable time when weather is pleasant and crops grow well.

months.name: Harvester
months.description: The third month of summer. The main harvest season when crops are gathered and stored for winter.

months.name: Patchwall
months.description: The first month of autumn. Time to repair and patch things before winter's arrival brings its harsh tests.

months.name: Ready'reat
months.description: The second month of autumn. Final preparations are made to retreat indoors for the coming winter.

months.name: Sunsebb
months.description: The third month of autumn. The sun's power ebbs and weakens as the year draws toward its close.

weekdays.name: Starday
weekdays.description: First day of the week, sacred to celestial observation and divination

weekdays.name: Sunday
weekdays.description: Second day of the week, devoted to the sun and solar deities

weekdays.name: Moonday
weekdays.description: Third day of the week, sacred to the moon and lunar mysteries

weekdays.name: Godsday
weekdays.description: Fourth day of the week, devoted to worship and religious observances

weekdays.name: Waterday
weekdays.description: Fifth day of the week, associated with water, travel, and commerce

weekdays.name: Earthday
weekdays.description: Sixth day of the week, devoted to agriculture, craftsmanship, and earthly labors

weekdays.name: Freeday
weekdays.description: Seventh day of the week, a day of freedom, rest, and personal pursuits

intercalary.name: Needfest
intercalary.description: A week-long festival at year's end celebrating the winter solstice. A time of giving gifts to those in need and sharing warmth during the coldest season.

intercalary.name: Growfest
intercalary.description: A week-long festival celebrating the spring equinox and the return of growing season. Communities prepare for planting and new life.

intercalary.name: Richfest
intercalary.description: A week-long festival celebrating the summer solstice and the year's abundance. The peak celebration of wealth, prosperity, and the sun's power.

intercalary.name: Brewfest
intercalary.description: A week-long festival celebrating the autumn equinox and the completed harvest. Communities brew ale and celebrate the year's bounty with feasting and drinking.
